WorkItem.Description:
When sending messages from some PHP software (using Zend Framework) it cannot be received.
Problem probably will be in "<>" style brackets.
 
Is it possible to handle "malforms" like these?
 
 
Session log
*********************************************************
220 localhost smtp4dev ready
HELO JSA-PC
250 Nice to meet you
MAIL FROM:<CustomerSupport <support@example.com>>
501 Parameter <support@example.com>> is not recognised
QUIT
221 See you later aligator

Comments.Message:
Hi, thanks for reporting this issue.
I will look into this as soon as possible.

Absolutelly my pleasure. Thank you for such an app like this!
Im ready to help you in any way (dev builds etc.), so catch me on PM if you will wanna to help.

This "bug" im getting from one application always, so I am able to test it in future.
I've checked in a fix for this issue.
OK, i will test it when i will be back home... :) thx for the fix.
